Field.name: description
Field.String: This is a Model Element. This node and its sub tree contain a GORITE model, comprising Model Platforms and class definitions. The node label contains a model name, which can be anything. The description text is available for documentation.

Field.name: description
Field.String: This is a Model Platform element. It represents the Agent system corresponding to one project using circles of sustainability.

Field.name: description
Field.String:

The node label contains import declaration.
The description text is available for element documentation.

description
description
creation
Field.String: AgentSystem model = new AgentSystem(new Project("projectTestName"), new User("userTestID", "userTestName"));

Field.name: description
Field.String: The Agent responsible of the management of the General Issue and Normative Goal of the project.

Field.name: description
Field.String:
This is a Construction Argument Element. This node contains an expression to be used as an argument in an instantiation.
The node label contains the expression.
The description text is available for documentation.

Field.name: description
Field.String: This is a Performer Element. This node and its sub tree contain a definition of a particular GORITE Performer instance, which essentially is an instantiation of the Performer class or a class extending it (e.g., a Performer Type). The node label contains the performer's name, which can be anything in a Java string constant (in particular, any double-quote must be preceeded by a back-slash). The description text is available for element documentation.

Field.name: description
Field.String: This is the Main Issue Manager Agent. It handles General Issue and Normative Goal percepts, process them, and provide suggestions when it finds out some of them are relevants. Inherits from Performer.

Field.name: description
description
Field.String: This capability is allows the main issue manager agent to provide relevant suggestions about the general issue and/or normative goal.

Field.name: description
Field.String: This is a Capability Element. This node and its sub tree contain a definition of a particular GORITE Capability instance, which essentially is an instantiation of the Capability class or a class extending it (e.g., a Capability Type). The node label contains the name of the capability type class being instantiated, i.e., class name, which is a series of Java identifiers (excluding Java keywords), separated by periods. The description text is available for element documentation.

Field.name: description
Field.String: This plans creates a new General Issue in the Database. It triggers another plan responsible of finding suggestions using this new General Issue.

Field.name: description
Field.String: This is a Task Goal Element. This node and its sub tree contain a definition of a particular GORITE Task Goal instance, which essentially is an instantiation of the Goal class or a class extending it. The node label contains the goal name, which can be anything in a Java string constant (in particular, any double-quote must be preceeded by a back-slash). The description text is available for element documentation.

Field.name: context_note
Field.String: This is the Context collection of the Plan Element. This contains one or more Query elements that define the plan context. The node label is not editable. The description text is available for element documentation.

Field.name: precedence_code
Field.String: This is the Precedence attribute of the Plan Element. This node contains a Java code fragment in its description aspect. The node label is available for documentation. The description text contains the code fragment, which typically defines the precedence method.

Field.name: constructor
description
Field.String: This is a Performer Type Element. This node and its sub tree contain a definition of a GORITE Performer Type, which essentially is a class extending the Performer class. The node label contains the performer type name, which also is used as the name of the generated class, and therefore it needs to be a simple Java identifier (excluding Java keywords). The description text is available for element documentation.

Field.name: description
Field.String:
This is an Import Statement Element. This node contains a Java import declaration, without the leading keyword "import", and the ending semi-colon.
The node label contains import declaration.
The description text is available for element documentation.

Field.name: description
Field.String: This is a Plan Element. This node and its sub tree contain a definition of a particular GORITE Plan instance, which essentially is an instantiation of the Plan class or a class extending it. The node label contains the goal name, which can be anything in a Java string constant (in particular, any double-quote must be preceeded by a back-slash). The description text is available for element documentation.

Field.name: description
Field.String: This is a Task Goal Element. This node and its sub tree contain a definition of a particular GORITE Task Goal instance, which essentially is an instantiation of the Goal class or a class extending it. The node label contains the goal name, which can be anything in a Java string constant (in particular, any double-quote must be preceeded by a back-slash). The description text is available for element documentation.

Field.name: execute
description
Field.String: This is a Capability Type Element. This node and its sub tree contain a definition of a GORITE Capability Type, which essentially is a class extending the Capability class. The node label contains the capability type name, which also is used as the name of the generated class, and therefore it needs to be a simple Java identifier (excluding Java keywords). The description text is available for element documentation.

description
Field.String: This is a BDI Goal Element. This node and its sub tree contain a definition of a particular GORITE BDI Goal instance, which essentially is an instantiation of the BDIGoal class or a class extending it. Field.name: context_note
Field.String: This is the Context collection of the Plan Element. This contains one or more Query elements that define the plan context. The node label is not editable. The description text is available for element documentation.

Field.name: precedence_code
Field.String: This is the Precedence attribute of the Plan Element. This node contains a Java code fragment in its description aspect. The node label is available for documentation. The description text contains the code fragment, which typically defines the precedence method.

Field.name: description
Field.String: This is a Capability Element. This node and its sub tree contain a definition of a particular GORITE Capability instance, which essentially is an instantiation of the Capability class or a class extending it (e.g., a Capability Type). The node label contains the name of the capability type class being instantiated, i.e., class name, which is a series of Java identifiers (excluding Java keywords), separated by periods. The description text is available for element documentation.

Field.name: description
Field.String: This is a Capability Type Element. This node and its sub tree contain a definition of a GORITE Capability Type, which essentially is a class extending the Capability class. The node label contains the capability type name, which also is used as the name of the generated class, and therefore it needs to be a simple Java identifier (excluding Java keywords). The description text is available for element documentation.

Field.name: description
description
Field.String: This is a Sequence Goal Element. This sequence goal researches Indicators Suggestions in the Knowledge Base, focusing on a given Indicator.

Field.name: description
Field.String: This is a Task Goal Element which return always PASSED. It is used combined to the parent condition goal to avoid considering a failure when the BDI plan in the other branch of the condition isn't applicable in the context.

The description text is available for element documentation.

Field.name: description
Field.String:
This is a Relation Column Element. This node contains the name and documentation of a relation column.
The node label is available for documentation.
The description text is available for element documentation.

Field.name: description
Field.String: This is a Capability Type Element. This node and its sub tree contain a definition of a GORITE Capability Type, which essentially is a class extending the Capability class. The node label contains the capability type name, which also is used as the name of the generated class, and therefore it needs to be a simple Java identifier (excluding Java keywords). The description text is available for element documentation.

Field.name: description
Field.String: This is a Plan Element. This node and its sub tree contain a definition of a particular GORITE Plan instance, which essentially is an instantiation of the Plan class or a class extending it. The node label contains the goal name, which can be anything in a Java string constant (in particular, any double-quote must be preceeded by a back-slash). The description text is available for element documentation.

Field.name: description
Field.String: This is a Task Goal Element. This node and its sub tree contain a definition of a particular GORITE Task Goal instance, which essentially is an instantiation of the Goal class or a class extending it. The node label contains the goal name, which can be anything in a Java string constant (in particular, any double-quote must be preceeded by a back-slash). The description text is available for element documentation.

Field.name: description
Field.String:
This is an Import Statement Element. This node contains a Java import declaration, without the leading keyword "import", and the ending semi-colon.
The node label contains import declaration.
The description text is available for element documentation.
